comment: Part of Exercise 3 of [Munkres] p. 83. The topology of all subsets ` x ` of ` A ` such that the complement of ` x ` in ` A ` is infinite, or ` x ` is the empty set, or ` x ` is all of ` A ` , is the trivial topology when ` A ` is finite. (Contributed by ML, 14-Jul-2020.)
